triples.name: Consensus dynamics
triples.relevance: The survey reviews consensus control methods that enable multiagent systems to reach agreement through distributed algorithms.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: The core subject of the survey, addressing control and coordination in systems of multiple autonomous agents.

triples.name: Control system
triples.relevance: The foundational control theory framework upon which fixed-time and prescribed-time consensus methods are built.

triples.name: Mobile robot
triples.relevance: One of the primary application domains for fixed-time and prescribed-time consensus control discussed in the survey.

triples.name: Smart grid
triples.relevance: Another major application domain for consensus control methods in distributed power grid coordination systems.

triples.name: Distributed algorithm
triples.relevance: The theoretical foundation for how consensus is achieved through distributed computation and local agent interactions.
